When i start client, without a cache on my C: drive, it makes the folder and loads all the files directly in the cache folder, it doesn’t pull the Data, JFrame, Maps, Raw, or sprites folder though. I’m gonna have to add bits of code to pull the folders aren’t I?

item.title: Auto Cache Downloader
item.dc:creator: @t0n_t1n t0n t1n
item.description:
@t0n_t1n wrote:

Ok, i’ve followed a couple of tutorials for making it auto download my clients cache, i’ve tweaked a little but to no avail. It still doesn’t download correctly. Always gives me an error when loading up the client.

private final int VERSION = 1; // Version of cache private String cacheLink = "Cache download link"; // Link to cache

if(decompressors[0] != null) { abyte0 = decompressors[0].decompress(i); } if(abyte0 == null) { drawLoadingText(0, "Connecting to File Server..."); //new Update("Cache download link", "Cache.zip", signlink.findcachedir()); abyte0 = decompressors[0].decompress(i); } } catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); } if(abyte0 != null) { NamedArchive archive = new NamedArchive(abyte0, s); return archive; } while (true) { drawLoadingText(0, "Error loading... Please report!"); try { Thread.sleep(1000); } catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); } } }

above are the codes i’m using to do it, but i can’t seem to get it to work. The first are the lines i used in CacheDownloader.java, and the latter is in the client.java. Would it be plausable to just go ahead and use the latter code in the CacheDownloader?

Or could someone help me get the code right, i have the links to the cache.zip, does it need to be a .rar, or the folder it self, or what

Read full topic
